cons: A laptop is given at the beginning at NHO. I think it would be beneficial to incorporate the many paper handouts into links that can be later accessed online and retained with more ease over time versus the abundant waste of paper. More online resources and information sharing and less physical handouts that will inevitably become "unrecyclable" trash.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX
pros: Feel good about the work that you do each day.  Really an opportunity to give back and help others in need all over S. Texas.
cons: While the work is meaningful.  The political environment of this organization leaves little to be desired.  There are a handful of wonderful directors though and the regular staff are good people.  Since leaving and finding the company I work for now, a large, global for-profit with upper management making 3 times as much as MHMer's, it is interesting to me how politics is left out of the  equation, it is not tolerated, upper management does not consider themselves as "seperate" from the rest of the organization, very wonderful company, no pettiness and we all focus on getting the job done!  I had forgotten what it was like to work in a healthy and stable environment with people who understand business, integrity and stewardship...people who foster the best relationships with others and who do so with the highest levels of sincerity.  If is unfortunate that a company doing such amazing things like MHM has such a terrible work environment and lousy reputation to boot.
